results.title: The Holy Roman Empire
results.brief_description: Describes how an enormous section of western Europe was united under the idea of a single Christian government. Costumed re-enactments dramatize the division of powers and conflict between the popes and the emperors and the factors which led to the eventual decay of the Holy Roman Empire.

results.title: The Holy land: background for history and religion
results.brief_description: A picture of life in the Holy Land as background to the study of history and religion. Discusses its biblical history, its geography and its inhabitants, together with its significance in the lives of Christian peoples.

results.title: Holy Himalayas
results.creator_credit: K Khandpur, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: A pilgrimage to the Hindu holy Badrinath and Kedarnath, in the Garwhal district of Uttar Pradesh. These have been centres of pilgrimage through the ages, are visited by thousands every year, who climb on foot through the Himalayan Mountains, near the Tibetan border. Shows something of the life of the district and the nature of Hindu devotion.
results.creator_credit_for_label: K Khandpur, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India

results.title: The Story of Holmesglen Concrete Housing Project
results.creator_credit: Herschells Films and Housing Commission of Victoria
results.brief_description: The Housing Commission of Victoria has a huge project at Holmesglen, a suburb of Melbourne, for the manufacture of prefabricated houses. All components of a modern house or a block of flats are constructed at this factory and transported in bulk to the place of erection. Concrete walls, chimneys, fences, tiles for roofs, plumbing units, wooden door cupboards and other fittings are all shown under construction and are then shown being fitted into place as the house is erected. Credit is given to the research work being carried out by the CSIRO Building Research Division, particularly in regard to a new type of light weight concrete which has been developed there.

results.title: [Hollard Street story]
results.creator_credit: J. Blake Dalrymple and Films of Africa
results.brief_description: Growth of South Africa’s economy and the corresponding expansion of the nation’s trading house, the Johannesburg Stock Exchange, from the gold rush days to the era of industrial security.

results.title: Holiday with a purpose
results.brief_description: Shows the activities of children at the Lord Mayor’s Holiday Camp at Portsea, Victoria. The daily life, sporting activities and excursions, as well as the medical treatment received by the children.

results.title: A Holiday in South India
results.creator_credit: Jagat Murari, Ezra Mir and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: A family is seen holidaying in South India. Shows the hotels, street scenes, shopping facilities, handwoven fabrics and souvenirs obtainable; trips to places of interest.

results.title: Holiday album
results.creator_credit: Roy A. Driver and Herschells Films
results.brief_description: Snapshots from a family holiday album show tourist attractions throughout Victoria: recreation in the metropolitan area; winter sports at Mt Buffalo; springtime in the Grampians; a leisurely journey down the Murray in the paddle-steamer “Coonawarra”; sailing and fishing at Lakes Entrance; forest country at Marysville; the beaches along the Great Ocean Road. Commentary by Robert Peach.

results.title: Hobbing a spur gear. Part I. Setting of the change gears
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker and Emerson Yorke Studio
results.brief_description: Shows the factors governing the selection of the hob; how to select change-gear combinations for speed, feed, and index; how to identify the correct gears; how to mount the change gears; how to adjust for backlash; and how the change-gear strains are interrelated.
